item.title: Jean add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You have to fight for your life. That's the chief condition on which you hold it. " -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Jean add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Dreams come from the past, not from the future. Dreams shouldn't control you--you should control them. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jean add a quote by Nami Mun
item.description: "Hope was based on the unknown, and I liked knowing things. Like that I was going to fail. Failure had better odds. " -- Nami Mun

item.title: Jean add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "There was nothing in this world that was not a con, suddenly I understood this. Nothing really mattered, and nothing could be lost. " -- Miranda July

item.title: Jean add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Potential has a shelf life." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jean add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "What a terrible mistake to let go of something wonderful for something real." -- Miranda July

item.title: Jean add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When you die it's the same as if everybody else did too." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Jean add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I hate cameras. They are so much more sure than I am about everything." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jean add a quote by Gilbert Sorrentino
item.description: "Art cannot save anybody from anything." -- Gilbert Sorrentino

item.title: Jean add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Few people have the imagination for reality. " -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Jean add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Jean add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "My biggest fault is that the faults I was born with grow bigger each year. It's like I was raising chickens inside me. The chickens lay eggs and the eggs hatch into other chickens, which then lay eggs. Is this any way to live a life? What with all these faults I've got going, I have to wonder. Sure, I get by. But in the end, that's not the question, is it? " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jean add a quote by L.P. Hartley
item.description: "The past is a foreign country; they do things differently there." -- L.P. Hartley

item.title: Jean add a quote by Amy Hempel
item.description: "The worst of it is over now, and I can't say that I am glad. Lose that sense of loss--you have gone and lost something else." -- Amy Hempel

item.title: Jean add a quote by Rick Moody
item.description: "Have I mentioned that I expect death around every turn, that every blue sky has a safe sailing out of it, that every bus runs me over, that every low, mean syllable uttered in my direction seems to intimate the violence of murder, that every family seems like an opportunity for ruin and every marriage a ceremony into which calamity will fall and hearts will be broken and lives destroyed and people branded by the mortifications of love? " -- Rick Moody

item.title: Jean add a quote by David Benioff
item.description: "Truth might be stranger than fiction, but it needs a better editor. " -- David Benioff

item.title: Jean add a quote by David R. Dow
item.description: "Socrates had it backward. He thought the unexamined life is not worth living. I think no one's life holds up to examination. The more time you spend thinking the more you notice that everyone else is doing something better or more important than you." -- David R. Dow

item.title: Jean add a quote by Darin Strauss
item.description: "Judgment helps one to make the appropriate decision at the appropriate moment and diminish the influence of fate." -- Darin Strauss

item.title: Jean add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "[Cannery Row's] inhabitants are, as the man once said, 'whores, pimps, gamblers, and sons of bitches,' by which he meant everybody. Had the man looked through another peephole he might have said, 'saints and angels and martyrs and holy men,' and he would have meant the same thing." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jean add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "One of these days they'll be making a film where the whole human race gets wiped out in a nuclear war, but everything works out in the end. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jean add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jean add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Query: How does the never to be differ from what never was?" -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Jean add a quote by Adam Rapp
item.description: "It was at that moment that I came to the conclusion that there is some link between plants and loneliness. " -- Adam Rapp

item.title: Jean add a quote by Nami Mun
item.description: "I knew that we'd never get there. I knew this, in the same way I knew Tati would never be a teacher, and that Benny would be the end of me. Life's about confirming what we already know. About making sure. " -- Nami Mun

item.title: Jean add a quote by David Lipsky
item.description: "My ambition is to not embarrass myself--which, if you know me, is a pretty serious ambition." -- David Lipsky

item.title: Jean add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt." -- Jack London

item.title: Jean add a quote by Darin Strauss
item.description: "I suppose memory has at least two faces, and capricious ones at that." -- Darin Strauss

item.title: Jean add a quote by Darin Strauss
item.description: "I have come to love you in spite of---" Do I want to be loved in spite of?...Does anyone?" -- Darin Strauss

item.title: Jean add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am paving hell with energy... I am laying down good intentions which I believe durable as flint." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jean add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "(Such a life)engaged gross quantities of hope and despair and set them wildly side by side, like a Third World country of the heart. " -- Lorrie Moore
